senses.de: A person who acts on behalf of another person or group
senses.ex: She is acting as the agent for the company's Asian clients

Tips.title: Agent's Authority
Tips.description: Understand that an agent has authority from someone else to act on their behalf in specific situations.
Tips.example: As my agent, you can sign the contract for me.

Tips.title: Not Always Physical
Tips.description: An agent can represent someone without being physically present.
Tips.example: She will be my agent at the negotiations via video call.

senses.de: A person or thing that takes an active role or produces a specified effect

Tips.title: Causation
Tips.description: When 'agent' refers to a thing, it usually implies that it is the direct cause of an effect.
Tips.example: Sunlight is the main agent of color fading in fabrics.

Tips.title: Scientific Implications
Tips.description: In science, 'agent' often describes substances with specific effects in reactions or processes.
Tips.example: This compound acts as a reducing agent in the reaction.

senses.de: A person who manages business, financial, or contract matters for an actor, performer, writer, or other public figure
senses.ex: Her literary agent got her a book deal

Tips.title: Career Facilitator
Tips.description: Agents in entertainment or literature are specialists who help creatives find work and negotiate deals.
Tips.example: My agent will handle all auditions and casting calls for me.

Tips.title: Not Just Promoters
Tips.description: Agents do more than promote; they manage financial and contractual details.
Tips.example: Her agent reviews all contracts to ensure fair terms.

senses.ex: He was a secret agent for the government

Tips.title: Hidden Identity
Tips.description: In a governmental or military context, an agent often works undercover or keeps their role secret.
Tips.example: The agent gathered intelligence without revealing his true identity.

Tips.title: Espionage Context
Tips.description: Understand that 'agent' implies the spy's affiliation with an organization or country.
Tips.example: The double agent provided false information to the enemy.

senses.de: A person capable of exerting power or influence
senses.ex: The principal agent of society and culture

Tips.title: Metaphorical Usage
Tips.description: 'Agent' can be used metaphorically to describe someone driving change, not just physically doing things.
Tips.example: Gandhi was a significant agent of change in India.

Tips.title: Influence and Power
Tips.description: An 'agent' in this context usually has the power or influence to affect large-scale change.
Tips.example: Innovators can be powerful agents of technological advancement.

senses.de: A person or company that provides a particular service, especially the mediation of business transactions

Tips.title: Business Intermediary
Tips.description: Agents facilitate business deals, acting as the middleman between two parties.
Tips.example: The shipping agent arranged the transport of our goods.

Tips.title: Wide Range of Services
Tips.description: The word 'agent' can refer to various types of services, not just those related to property or travel.
Tips.example: The aid agency provided relief to the disaster-stricken area.

Broker.wordDefinition:
Both agent and broker refer to a person who acts as a middleman in a transaction or negotiation between two parties.

A broker acts as an intermediary between two parties and helps them negotiate a deal or transaction. Unlike an agent, a broker does not represent either party in the transaction, but instead, facilitates the negotiation process.

For example, a stockbroker helps investors to buy and sell stocks and earns a commission on each transaction.

An agent can represent and act on behalf of one party, while a broker helps both parties to come to an agreement. While both of these terms are used in multiple industries, they have slightly different meanings and applications.

Delegate.wordDefinition:
Delegate typically refers to a person who is chosen or elected to represent a group or organization. For example, a delegate to a political convention represents their state's political party and is able to vote on behalf of their state.

An agent is authorized to act on someone's behalf, while a delegate is chosen to represent a group or organization.

Executor.wordDefinition:
An executor is a person assigned to manage the estate of a person who has died. The executor's role is to ensure that the deceased person's wishes are carried out in accordance with their will.

An agent is hired by someone to act on their behalf, while an executor is appointed to manage the affairs of someone who has died.

Intermediary.wordDefinition:
An intermediary is someone who acts as a go-between or middleman in a transaction or negotiation between two parties. For example, a travel intermediary might help match travelers with hotels and transportation.

Both terms refer to individuals or entities that help facilitate transactions or negotiations, but the key difference is that an agent is specifically working on behalf of one of the parties involved, while an intermediary is positioned between the two parties and doesn't necessarily represent either one exclusively.

Manage.wordDefinition:
Manage means to be in charge of something, such as a team or a project. A manager is responsible for making decisions, assigning tasks, and overseeing the work of others.

In summary, while both words involve handling tasks and responsibilities, an agent represents someone else while a manager is in charge of a team or project.

Negotiator.wordDefinition:
A negotiator is someone who helps facilitate a deal or agreement between two parties by discussing, compromising and finding a mutually beneficial solution.

They may represent one or both parties but their main goal is to reach a favorable outcome for everyone involved. For example, a union negotiator represents workers in collective bargaining discussions with their company’s management team.

An agent represents a single party’s interests while a negotiator seeks to find a mutually satisfactory agreement between two opposing parties.

Operator.wordDefinition:
An agent is a person or company that acts on behalf of someone else, while an operator is a person or entity that manages or operates a system or piece of equipment.

For example, a travel agent books travel arrangements for clients, while a telephone operator helps connect phone calls.

In the context of technology, a computer software agent may automate tasks for a user, while a computer operator manages the computer system.

An agent is focused on representing a person or company, while an operator is focused on managing a system or equipment.

Proxy.wordDefinition:
Proxy is used to refer to a person or thing that is authorized to act on behalf of someone else.

A proxy can be a representative who is authorized to vote on behalf of a shareholder in a company.

It can also refer to a server that is used to access the internet on behalf of a user, like a proxy server that masks a user's IP address.

In summary, while both words refer to representing someone or something else, an agent tends to be more of an active participant in that representation, while a proxy is more of a passive stand-in.

An agent might actively negotiate for a client, while a proxy simply carries out the orders of the person they represent.

Representative.wordDefinition:
A representative is someone who speaks or acts on behalf of someone else, but does not have the same level of authority as an agent.

An agent is used in situations where a higher level of trust and authority is needed, while a representative is used in situations where communication or advocacy is the priority.

For example, a real estate agent would have the authority to make an offer on a property, while a political representative would speak on behalf of their constituents, but would still need to seek approval from their constituents before taking action.

quotes.Text: My agent called me up and said, 'There is a tremendous female lead in the new 'Star Wars' film, and I think you're really going to like it.' The opportunity to play someone determined, who's trying to find her skills as a leader; to be in a fantasy movie; to be able to do a leading female role in a film of that scale - that's very, very rare.
quotes.Title: English Actress
quotes.Name: Felicity Jones

quotes.Text: I got some cash from agents. I've talked to the NCAA. I think that should be legal. I want some money, too; everybody else is making money. I want to go on dates. I want to go buy myself some new suits. I want to buy myself some new sneakers, and I paid the agents back.
quotes.Title: American Baseball Player
quotes.Name: Charles Barkley

quotes.Text: I'm sure people in the business have said: She's too old for that part. I don't hear about it because your agent protects you from those negative things.
quotes.Title: English Actress
quotes.Name: Felicity Kendal

quotes.Text: Actors are agents of change. A film, a piece of theater, a piece of music, or a book can make a difference. It can change the world.
quotes.Title: British Actor
quotes.Name: Alan Rickman

quotes.Text: I have said to my agents, 'I want to work. I want to play character roles.
quotes.Title: Irish Actor
quotes.Name: Pierce Brosnan

quotes.Text: My agent said, 'You aren't good enough for movies.' I said, 'You're fired.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Sally Field

quotes.Text: It's hard to get someone, particularly agents, to tell you the truth.
quotes.Name: Ken Berry

quotes.Text: I couldn't let him die; I was the agent of life for Stephen.
quotes.Title: English Author
quotes.Name: Jane Hawking

quotes.Text: Free agents want to go to a winner and get paid.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: James L. Dolan

quotes.Text: I have the best agents in the world.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Guy Fieri
